item.description:
Optimum Health Solution~Raw New England Community Dinner Speaker Series presents

Preserving the Harvest with Lacto-Fermentation

Discussion, Demonstration & Samples by Sharon A. Kane, Instructor, Food As Medicine

Discussion will include a bit of history, a bit of science and a bit about why lacto-fermented foods are so beneficial to us.

Demonstration will involve going through all the steps to create a delicious and probiotic-rich jar of sauerkraut.

When: Tuesday, November 17, 2009, 5:30 - 9:30 pm

Where: UMass Waltham Center, 240 Beaver St, Waltham, MA 02452

Donation: Save $5.00 by RSVP through website www.optimumhealthsolution.org/blog

$20 at door
Bring an organic raw vegan dish for 8 people or pay $10 to eat.

Questions, call Betsy Bragg 781-899-6664 or cell 617-835-2913 or email betsy@optimumhealthsolution.org. Donations go to benefit OHS non-profit dedicated to "feeding children a healthy future".

Sharon A. Kane, offers hands-on classes in Lacto-fermented vegetables, Kombucha and Vegan Kefir. She can be reached at Sharon@food-medicine.com, www.food-medicine.com, 508-881-5678




Posted by Rev. Martha Muehe (www.essenic.com)
item.name: Sharon Kane & Potluck
